message:
Hi all,
I need some help please.

I'm trying to make simple web api and cal it from angular.js service, and use this service in angular.js controller, then show up the returned list in my html file.
I did the following steps:-

1- I made simple web api and edit WebApiConfig file like (Reference 1) to force this Api to return json.

2- It returns json as it appears from the (Reference 2) when i run the api project and type it's url.

3- I created angular service as it appears in (Reference 3) to get json object from the web api.

4- I created angular controller as it appears in (Reference 4).

5- I created another angular service returns hard coded array of objects and tried it and it runs in browser as it appears in (Reference 5).

6- The problem comes when i'm trying to get array of object from this web api,
on button click event the browser throws this exception in console (Reference 6) and does not show books Table.

7- Note that there is no wrong steps in js reference files, or in looping on array of object cause it runs fine with localService with hard coded data comes from the other service.

What is the wrong in these steps???

I think the problem is in receiving json object from web api (Reference 3) but i googled it many time and can't find solution.

Thanks in advance.

data.message:
It seems like a cross domain origin problem, if you expect your API and Web Client to be on different domains you will need to have CORS filters
This can help
http://www.asp.net/web-api/overview/security/enabling-cross-origin-requests-in-web-api
Just be careful to be explicit on which domains are allowed so you don't open yourself to security problems
Please .. Could you tell me the reference name of HttpConfiguration ?? it's need to include it outsource from Nuget Packages ?
